info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Evangeline, southern Avoyelles and northern St. Landry Parishes through 845 PM CDT... At 821 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Simmesport to near Reddell. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eunice, Ville Platte, Bunkie, Mamou, Simmesport, Moreauville, Turkey Creek, Palmetto, Bordelonville, Bayou Current, Morrow, Cottonport, Pine Prairie, Mansura, Washington, Chataignier, Evergreen, Plaucheville, Bayou Chicot and Goudeau. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 27 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
